text: The architecture of Mughals was fascinating and marvellous. The Mughals ruled the Sub-Continent (modern day Pakistan, India and Bangladesh) from 1526 to late 18th century. Their architecture sense was one of its kind which can be seen in Taj Mahal (India) ,Badshahi Mosque and Shahi Qila (Pakistan). The architecture mainly included floral designs, patterns and calligraphy. Category:Architecture
title: Mughal architecture
